vulnerabilities.description: RSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature verification vulnerability in node-forge
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Upgrade to node-forge 1.3.1 or later immediately

analysis.justification: Node-forge is used for cryptographic operations in payment processing and blockchain wallet signatures. Signature forgery could allow unauthorized transactions.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: This vulnerability is actively exploited (KEV). Used in payment-processor and blockchain-gateway for transaction signing. Immediate patching required. Financial impact: potential unauthorized transactions worth millions.

analysis.justification: Socket.io is used for real-time market data streaming to trading dashboard. Authentication bypass allows unauthorized access to proprietary trading signals and market data.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Market data WebSocket is internet-facing. Unauthorized access could leak trading strategies and cause financial losses. Emergency patch scheduled for tonight.

vulnerabilities.description: Ethers.js private key extraction via timing side-channel
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Upgrade to ethers 6.0.0 or later immediately

analysis.justification: Ethers.js is used in blockchain-gateway for cryptocurrency wallet management. Private key extraction could allow theft of customer crypto assets.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Blockchain-gateway manages customer crypto wallets with millions in assets. Private key compromise = direct financial theft. IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED.

analysis.justification: Web3.js is used for Ethereum blockchain interactions. Prototype pollution could manipulate transaction parameters (amounts, recipients).
analysis.detail: HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Used in blockchain-gateway for transaction construction. Could allow attackers to redirect crypto transfers. Upgrade scheduled for this week.

analysis.justification: Express res.redirect() is only used with hardcoded internal URLs. No user-controlled redirect destinations.
analysis.detail: LOW PRIORITY: Code review confirms all redirect URLs are hardcoded constants. No user input in redirect logic. Upgrade planned for next maintenance window.

analysis.justification: Sequelize is used throughout the application. Investigating whether raw queries with user input are used anywhere.
analysis.detail: MEDIUM PRIORITY: Sequelize is used but preliminary code review shows only parameterized queries. Comprehensive audit in progress. Upgrade scheduled for next sprint.
